pullRequest.body:
- Now the perfect closure is a perfect ring without requiring base ring to be a field.
- Add `mk_pow` and `mk_surjective`.
- Add explicit names to all of the instances.
- Add docstrings for the file.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: acmepjz can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Since you are at it, do you mind add a short section at the beginning with a description of the content of the file? Thanks!

Docstrings added. Does it look OK?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7806510290/job/21293022090)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7806510290/job/21293021916)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7806510290/job/21293022266)
Thanks a lot. Just a couple of cosmetic comments and a name change (not your fault, and hopefully a trivial change).

Since you are at it, do you mind add a short section at the beginning with a description of the content of the file? Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks a lot. Just a couple of cosmetic comments and a name change (not your fault, and hopefully a trivial change).

```suggestion
- `PerfectClosure.mk K p (n, x)`: for `n : ` and `x : K` this is `x ^ (p ^ -n)` viewed as an element of `PerfectClosure K p`. Every element of `PerfectClosure K p` is of this form
  (`PerfectClosure.mk_surjective`).
```

```suggestion
- `PerfectClosure.induction_on`: to prove a result for all elements of the prefect closure, one only
  needs to prove it for all elements of the form `x ^ (p ^ -n)`.
```
I think those are not needed, but as you prefer.
I think we can also ignore it, but the name should be `PerfectClosure.mk_eq_iff`.

In fact the existing API confuses me, there is also `PerfectClosure.eq_iff` but which assumes moreover that `K` is reduced (and whose statement uses `Quot.mk` but not `PerfectClosure.mk` --- aren't they defeq ??? very strange), so the criterion becomes simpler, while the `PerfectClosure.eq_iff'` is stated for all rings.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(FieldTheory/PerfectClosure): change the order of some results
